oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quarterly return of ordnance stores received and issued

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832 - 1904; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Equipment and supplies; Quartermasters -- Tennessee; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten and hand-drawn Form No. 1 with categories listing date, voucher number, classes, small arms, accoutrements for muskets, miscellaneous, and remarks. These ordnance stores were to be received and issued at Nashville in the quarter ending June 30, 1864, by Assistant Quartermaster William Alonzo Wainwright.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Nashville Quartermaster Depot was established in 1863, primarily to supply the local camps and General Sherman's forces. It was a massive operation, with acres of corrals for animals, huge warehouses, repair shops, and rail yards. Over three-thousand men and five-hundred teams worked around the clock just to unload supplies that came by riverboat.
